newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch shares end mixed after touching record.
newsitem.headline: Dutch shares end mixed after touching record.

text.p: Dutch shares closed mixed to lower on Thursday with early gains eroded by profit-taking, although a late spike higher on the back of a firmer Wall Street opening helped bring prices above the session's low.

The AEX share index ended 0.83 points below Wednesday's record high close to finish Thursday at 870.63. Early gains continuing Wednesday's record-breaking rise pushed the AEX up briefly to a new intra-day high of 875.61.
"We're going through a choppy phase at the moment, the index could either back-track to 850 or go on up to 900, either looks possible although I think it looks overbought," said a dealer.
Thursday's early advances were concentrated in a handful of big-gaining blue-chips, such as Royal Dutch, Akzo and Philips which all finished with their gains pared.

"Apart from a few special situations there's not that much that's new in the market," said another dealer, noting that retail investors had pushed prices ahead in early dealings before institutions started taking profits.

Some dealers said the short to medium term trends point to the 34 percent rise in the AEX index so far in 1997 continuing, with 900 points in a couple of weeks seen as a staging post to a year-end destination of as high as 1,000 points.
"For the short term I think the market will go higher but for the medium term a lot depends on what the U.S. does about interest rates," said a dealer.
U.S. rates could come under upward pressure as authorities move to damp down wage inflation if jobs figures continue to show falling unemployment, he said.

Another dealer said his clients were telling him they were beginning to become sceptical of the room for more gains. "It's not that they plan to sell off, it's just that they're not looking to buy," he said, adding they could become aggressive buyers if the AEX corrected down to 815-820.
